page.title: 05CHRISTIAN RELIGIONS
page.content: The children of{Carterknowle school did a survey of religious beliefs in their area. They found 41%, of parents asked, went to church regularly, 8% occasionally, and 51% did not go. The most common denomination was Church of England, others were Baptist, Christian Science, Methodist, Elim Pentecostal, Roman Catholic and Non-Denominational. Nearby is Ecclesall Church of All Saints. A chapel was first erected here in 1779 on 2 acres of land. In l928 a further 6 acres was needed for burials. The oldest grave dates from 1795. There is a plaque commemorating{Florence {Nightingale's}grandfather. The cross on the main altar has the words{"via {Crusis via Luc"(the way of the cross {is the way of the light).}In 1908 the original altar was changed to a detached altar.
